chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
i: interval
x: nat

Goal:
in_interval i x -> out_interval i x -> False

Premises:
in_interval = fun i (x : nat) => let (a, b) := i in a <= x < b : interval -> nat -> Prop Arguments in_interval _ _%nat_scope
out_interval = fun i (x : nat) => let (a, b) := i in x < a \/ b <= x : interval -> nat -> Prop Arguments out_interval _ _%nat_scope
interval_disjoint = fun i j => forall x : nat, in_interval i x -> in_interval j x -> False : interval -> interval -> Prop
dio_rel_finite_conj : forall (n : nat) (R : nat -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop), (forall i : nat, i < n -> 𝔻R (R i)) -> 𝔻R (fun ν : nat -> nat => forall i : nat, i < n -> R i ν)
bounded_quantification.fmap_reifier_t_default : forall (X : Type) (Q : nat -> X -> Prop) (k : nat), X -> (forall i : nat, i < k -> {x : X | Q i x}) -> {f : nat -> X | forall i : nat, i < k -> Q i (f i)}
interval_union = fun i j => let (a1, b1) := i in let (a2, b2) := j in (Init.Nat.min a1 a2, Init.Nat.max b1 b2) : interval -> interval -> nat * nat
sums.msum_comm : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), sums.monoid_theory m u -> forall (a : X) (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), (forall i : nat, i < n -> m (f i) a = m a (f i)) -> m (sums.msum m u n f) a = m a (sums.msum m u n f)
Nat.divide = fun x y : nat => exists z : nat, y = z * x : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments Nat.divide (_ _)%nat_scope
utils_tac.measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
VectorDef.fold_right : (?A -> ?B -> ?B) -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> ?B -> ?B where ?A : [i : interval x : nat |- Type] ?B : [i : interval x : nat |- Type]
VectorDef.map : (?A -> ?B) -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n where ?A : [i : interval x : nat |- Type] ?B : [i : interval x : nat |- Type]
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
df_pred = fix df_pred (f : dio_formula) (ν : nat -> nat) {struct f} : Prop := match f with | df_cst x n => ν x = n | df_eq x y => ν x = ν y | df_op o x y z => ν x = de_op_sem o (ν y) (ν z) | df_bin o f0 g => df_op_sem o (df_pred f0 ν) (df_pred g ν) | ∃ f0 => exists n : nat, df_pred f0 n·ν end : dio_formula -> (nat -> nat) -> Prop Arguments df_pred _ _%function_scope
Nat.div_mod : forall x y : nat, y <> 0 -> x = y * (x / y) + x mod y
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
id_phi_N = fun x : BinNums.N => x : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments id_phi_N _%N_scope
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rm...
Record monoid_theory (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) : Prop := mk_monoid { monoid_unit_l : forall x : X, m u x = x; monoid_unit_r : forall x : X, m x u = x; monoid_assoc : forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z } Arguments sums.monoid_theory [X]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments sums.mk_monoid [X]%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _ _)%function_scope
Record ring_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkmorph { morph0 : req (phi cO) rO; morph1 : req (phi cI) rI; morph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); morph_sub : forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y)); morph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); morph_opp : forall x...
Zbool.Zeq_bool = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match BinInt.Z.compare x y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> bool Arguments Zbool.Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive sigT (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) : Type := existT : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A & P x} Arguments sigT [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments existT [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
VectorDef.caseS' : forall (v : VectorDef.t ?A (S ?n)) (P : VectorDef.t ?A (S ?n) -> Type), (forall (h : ?A) (t : VectorDef.t ?A ?n), P (VectorDef.cons ?A h ?n t)) -> P v where ?A : [i : interval x : nat |- Type] ?n : [i : interval x : nat |- nat]
existT : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (x : A), P x -> {x : A & P x}
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.opp = fun x : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos x0 => BinNums.Zneg x0 | BinNums.Zneg x0 => BinNums.Zpos x0 end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.opp _%Z_scope
sums.power_S : forall n x : nat, sums.mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 (S n) x = x * sums.mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 n x
sums.power_0 : forall x : nat, sums.mscal Init.Nat.mul 1 0 x = 1
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
